name: Everest Base Camp
description: Classic trek to the foot of Mount Everest.
overview: A high-altitude trek through Sherpa country ending at Everest Base Camp.

name: Gokyo Lakes & Gokyo Ri
description: Scenic lakes and panoramic mountain views in the Khumbu.
overview: Alternate route to Everest region with stunning turquoise lakes and high viewpoints.

name: Everest Three Passes (extended)
description: Challenging circuit across three high passes in the Everest region.
overview: A demanding route for experienced trekkers seeking remote high passes.

name: Annapurna Circuit
description: Classic long circuit around the Annapurna massif.
overview: Varied terrain and cultural diversity with a high mountain pass.

name: Annapurna Base Camp
description: Popular trek to the base of Annapurna massif.
overview: Accessible route with varied scenery and mountain views.

name: Poon Hill Trek
description: Short popular trek ideal for quick mountain views.
overview: Great for beginners and families, famous for sunrise viewpoints.

name: Mardi Himal Trek
description: Less-crowded Annapurna trek with excellent mountain views.
overview: Shorter alternative to ABC with high viewpoints.

name: Manaslu Circuit
description: Wild and remote circuit around Manaslu peak.
overview: A quieter alternative to Annapurna with high passes and cultural richness.

name: Kanchenjunga Base Camp
description: Very remote trek to the base of the world's third highest mountain.
overview: Long expedition-style trek across rugged terrain.

name: Makalu Base Camp
description: Remote alpine trek with dramatic mountain views.
overview: Less-travelled route to Makalu region requiring good fitness.

name: Langtang & Gosaikunda
description: Combines Langtang valley with holy alpine lakes at Gosaikunda.
overview: Great option for moderate trekkers near Kathmandu.

name: Helambu Trek
description: Accessible trek north of Kathmandu through Tamang villages.
overview: Good short trek for acclimatization and cultural visits.

name: Rolwaling Valley Trek
description: Remote valley with glaciers and alpine meadows.
overview: Less-visited region offering solitude and big mountain scenery.

name: Upper Mustang (Lo Manthang)
description: Tibetan-influenced desert landscapes and Lo Manthang.
overview: Unique cultural and geological landscape on Nepal's northern plateau.

name: Upper Dolpo (Shey Phoksundo)
description: Very remote trek across high plateaus to turquoise lakes.
overview: One of Nepal's most isolated and spectacular treks.

name: Dhaulagiri Circuit
description: Challenging long circuit around Dhaulagiri massif.
overview: Epic, remote trekking with high passes and remote villages.

name: Jomsom - Tilicho Lake
description: Route to one of the world's highest lakes, Tilicho.
overview: High-altitude lake with dramatic scenery and remoteness.

name: Pikey Peak Trek
description: Short trek with excellent mountain panoramas.
overview: Good acclimatization trek with cultural exposure.

name: Ghandruk - Australian Camp Loop
description: Popular short trekking loop around Ghandruk.
overview: Ideal for families and short visits from Pokhara.

name: Tamang Heritage Trail
description: Cultural trek through Tamang villages near Kathmandu.
overview: Accessible trail with cultural insights and mountain views.

name: Cho La Pass (Gokyo - Everest link)
description: High glacier pass and remote crossing.
overview: Requires experience and good weather windows.

name: Shivapuri - Nagarkot Ridge
description: Short ridge hike suitable as a day trip from Kathmandu.
overview: Popular for sunrise and quick nature escapes.

name: Bandipur - Ghalegaun Cultural Trail
description: Short cultural trails with village homestays.
overview: Good for cultural immersion and light trekking.

name: Chandragiri Hill Day Trek
description: Quick day hike with views over Kathmandu Valley.
overview: Accessible for families and short stays.

name: Gosaikunda - Langtang Rim
description: Lakes and ridgelines combining Langtang and Gosaikunda areas.
overview: Shorter moderate route with alpine lakes and views.
